short_summary: The bidder has requested the list of members of the "Technical Committee " and apparently the bidder has gotten it by mistake as previously reported. ",initiation_date": "2024-01-25","notice_url": "https://tc.canada.ca/fr/nontender/opportunities/tcdoccuments/"}),
description: Please see description below to be sure as this is a clarification notice which amends the first SOLICITATION/Demande de soumission e-cat-3905704 issue on October 2023.
full_summary:
### Stage 1 - Tremblay Oil Spill Response, Dawson National Historic Site

**Reference Number:** cb-710-42440672
**Amendment Number:** 6
**Solicitation Number:** 5P468-23-0297/A

### Request for Proposal

Parks Canada invites qualified contractors to submit a bid for the Stage 1 - Tremblay Oil Spill Response project at the Dawson National Historic Site.

**Scope of Work:**
Construction of an in-situ containment wall to prevent oil spill migration from a historical building to neighboring properties and roadways. Estimated project value: $250,001 to $500,000 (inclusive of applicable taxes).

**Process:**
Bids will be accepted through email or fax (1-855-983-1808). Only email submissions will be processed, and links to bid documents will not be accepted. Documents must be attached to the email. The maximum email file size accepted by Parks Canada is 15 megabytes.

**Key Dates:**

* Tender Closing Date: 2024-02-08T16:00:00
* Expected Contract Start Date: 2024-03-01
* Expected Contract End Date: 2024-04-30

**Evaluation Criteria:**
Bidders will be evaluated on their qualifications and considered to proceed to the next stage of the procurement process. The evaluation process is described in the ITT.

**Pre-Qualification List:**
The list of pre-qualified bidders from Stage 1 will not be released.

**Contact Information:**
For all inquiries, please contact:
Ken Lacanilao
Email: [kenneth.lacanilao@pc.gc.ca](mailto:kenneth.lacanilao@pc.gc.ca)
Phone: (587) 832-1894

**Trade Agreement:**
This procurement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

**Solicitation Documents:**
Bidders are requested to review the solicitation documents on the Government of Canada's tendering service website: http://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/tender-opportunities. Addenda will be available on the website.

**Excavation Regulations:**
The National Parks Regulations must be followed. Questions regarding the solicitation documents should be directed to the Contracting Authority. Late submissions will not be considered.

### End of Entry

Please let me know if you need further assistance!
